title.narrative: OUTPUT 23: COMMUNICATION AND SOCIAL CHANGE

description.narrative: Girls, boys, women and men in selected areas have increased understanding of violence and harmful practices that affect children especially girls, which contributes to Prevention Of Harmful Practice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, girls and boys in Ghana, especially the most disadvantaged, increasingly benefit from an equitable and integrated child protection system.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Girls, boys, women and men in selected areas have increased understanding of violence and harmful practices that affect childrenespecially girls

description.narrative: Ghanaians Against Child Abuse (GACA) campaign reached over 16 million through television, radio, face to face engagement and social media with messages related to the prevention of violence against children. This was further complemented by reaching 2,417 communities with community-based engagements (with the use of the Child Protection Facilitation Toolkit) on child protection, Sexual and Gender-Based Violence (SGBV), COVID -19 prevention and mental health and psychosocial support services.; These engagements have triggered some individual, family, and community-level actions that promote children&39;s safe and protective environment. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2021
